conclusion: Determine the time taken for light to travel from point O to the AB boundary inside a transparent body with a right-angled trapezoid cross-section.
The transparent body is a right-angled trapezoid ABDE. The light enters the body at point O, which is on the AE boundary.
Use Snell's Law at the entry point O with n1 = 1 and n2 = sqrt(2).
Given theta1 = 45 degrees, calculate sin(theta2) = 1/2, resulting in theta2 = 30 degrees.
Determine the path length inside the material with theta2 = 30 degrees.
Calculate the path length L = h / cos(theta2).
Calculate time t = L / v, where v = c / sqrt(2).
Combine equations to get t = L sqrt(2) / c.
Final expression for time t = 2h sqrt(2) / (c sqrt(3)).
